title: router.navigate() modifies previous request in browser when used in JSP.
body:
### Description I am trying to integrate angular app on JSP page, when the code hit the line router.navigate() browser just throws the previous request . below is the summary : ### CASE 1: without angular Page A ---POST(mandatory request body)----> Page B----> reload button ---> POST(mandatory request body)--->page B (wihout agnular) ### CASE 2: with angular Page A ---POST(mandatory request body) ----> Page B ------> reload button----->GET(all mandatory fields lost) --> failure becasue all mandatory fields are missing (angular) we have servlet filters on server side which checks for mandatory attributes in request body, when angular app is loaded the previous POST request is lost and in first case it is preserved. ### Current behavior: on reload GET request is sent to server. ### Expected behavior: on reload browser should send POST request which was used to render current JSP page ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.2.4
Node: 10.15.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.13
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.12.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.12.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.12.4
@angular-devkit/core              7.2.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.2.4
@angular/cli                      7.2.4
@ngtools/webpack                  7.2.4
@schematics/angular               7.2.4
@schematics/update                0.12.4
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack
**Anything else relevant?** I have noticed that when router.navigate() is not present on angular app previous post request is preserved but if present then previous POST request is vanished somehow.

title: Throw an error when templating braces are used to pass attribute values
body: Hi! I've been using Angular for a few years now, and I regularly come across projects where previous developers used the templating braces to pass attribute values, doing awful sins such as: `` Instead of `` I'm starting to seriously pull my hair off by having to fix a ton of occurrences of the error described above, and for this reason I think it'd be really neat if Angular was just throwing an error at build time, runtime or both, preventing inexperienced developer to misuse templating braces. Thanks!

title: Documentation for :ng-deep is misleading / incomplete

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
### Description

The documentation for ng-deep states

> Component styles normally apply only to the HTML in the component's own template.
> 
> Use the /deep/ shadow-piercing descendant combinator to force a style down through the child component tree into all the child component views. The /deep/ combinator works to any depth of nested components, and it applies to both the view children and content children of the component.

This is misleading because styles affected by `::ng-deep` don't only affect "child component views"- they affect _all views globally_. 

It would be more accurate to say that `::ng-deep` turns off view-encapsulation for that style declaration such that it becomes a global style.

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/guide/component-styles#deprecated-deep--and-ng-deep

title: Lazy-loading with new import syntax throws in AoT

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When using the new lazy-loading import syntax with VE, if the lazy-loaded route is declared in a separate file, then the AoT compilation fails. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction A repo is available to reproduce: https://github.com/cexbrayat/lazy-laoding-import Running `ng build --aot` will trigger the error. Basically, the problem happens when the routes are declared in a separate file: https://github.com/cexbrayat/lazy-laoding-import/blob/master/src/app/app.routes.ts#L3-L6 Note that if the routes are declared directly in `app;module.ts` the error does not occur. ## üî• Exception or Error 

ERROR in src/app/app.module.ts(14,26): Error during template compile of 'AppModule'
  Function expressions are not supported in decorators in 'ROUTES'
    'ROUTES' contains the error at src/app/app.routes.ts(5,29)
      Consider changing the function expression into an exported function.

closes #29893

## PR Checklist

## What is the new behavior?
when a ServiceWorker update has been activated, we remove the scroll Position from the sessionStorage before the nagivation

title: feat(ivy): ngDevMode has state getter methods

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
- Moves all perf counters under `ngDevMode.perfCounters`
- Adds all global state getter methods to `ngDevMode.state`. For example: `ngDevMode.state.getLView()` or `ngDevMode.state.getSelectedIndex()`.

This should be useful when debugging issues with global state.

title: feat(ivy): generate …µ…µproperty instructions

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
- Adds generation of `…µ…µproperty` instructions to compiler
- Fixes issues where global state for selected index and active directives were getting out of sync.
- Resolves an issue where selected index was being prematurely set before hooks were being executed.

Related #29881

title: test(ivy): test for directive inheritance in combination with animation trigger listeners in ivy

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
Angular Ivy ensures that metadata is inherited between components and
directives which means that animation host listeners are assigned both
in the super-class directive/component as well as the sub-class. This
means that if an animation trigger emits a start or done event in both
the context of a super-class and sub-class then the host listener will
be fired twice (which is expected).

title: RFC: AsyncPipe doesn't necessarily need WrappedValue

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/common ### Is this a regression? No, it's likely a design failure from the very beginning. ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... In [`WrappedValue`](https://angular.io/api/core/WrappedValue) documentation, it's saying: > Indicates that the result of a [`Pipe`](https://angular.io/api/core/Pipe) transformation has changed even though the reference has not changed. But inside [`AsyncPipe`](https://angular.io/api/common/AsyncPipe) whether or not returning an `WrappedValue` is fully based on reference changed or not: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9147092a156203d46cd1c865e06fa72a1e2d4137/packages/common/src/pipes/async_pipe.ts#L106-L111 It will only wrap the first changed value into `WrappedValue`, all the subsequent unchanged values will retain unwrapped, even changing the observable reference won't make any effect: https://stackblitz.com/edit/typescript-bzkarv Otherwise, even the same value being re-emitted many times during change detection, it won't be wrapped and no error is reported: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-kqkpym?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts I don't know what's the difference if `AsyncPipe` just return the unwrapped value and let the change detector to check it. Please correct me if I am wrong. And then, what's the meaning of `WrappedValue` as not need by Angular itself? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Linked above. ## üî• Exception or Error 
N/A
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
N/A
**Anything else relevant?** The question was found when digging into https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/22305.

title: Docs: Reactive forms guide lists incorrect fields

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... In the [reactive forms guide](https://angular.io/guide/reactive-forms#step-2-grouping-the-nested-form-in-the-template), the sentence tells you to add fields: ``` Add the `address` form group containing the `firstName` and `lastName` fields to the `ProfileEditor` template. ``` It should tell you to add the remaining fields instead. ``` Add the `address` form group containing the `street`, `city`, `state`, and `zip` fields to the `ProfileEditor` template. ```` Line 233 should be updated here https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/aio/content/guide/reactive-forms.md ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/... ### Reproduction Steps** ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant?
